means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 佩斯绰号，温和的人，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“和睦，和谐，友好”(peace,concord,amity)
Performance and Cost Evaluation 性能与成本估价

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"速度，速率"之意。
means: speed ： 普通用词，指单位时间内行进的固定速度或速率，也指可能达到的最高速度。
rate作"速度"讲时，与speed同义，可换用。作速率解时，指相对增长的速度，也指两种相比较而得出的标准速度。
velocity ： 技术用词，指物体沿着一定方向运动时的速率。
pace ： 普通用词，指步行的速度，常引申指活动的进度或生产率。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"步，步态"之意。
means: step ： 普通用词，指脚抬起落下的动作和一步的距离。抽象概念指步骤。
pace ： 指身体向前移动的速度和情况。表一步距离时，可与step换用。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"行走，徒步"之意。
means: walk ： 最常用词，中性词，指除跑、跳之外所有移步的动作。
stride ： 着重步子大而且节奏有力，流露出匆忙、烦恼、得意等情绪。
stroll ： 多指走走停停，步子缓慢，悠闲自得，漫无目的。
strut ： 指大摇大摆地走，含过分自信或自高自大意味。

sentence.Network_en: Interest rates would come down as the recovery gathered pace.
sentence.Network_cn: 随着复苏的加速，利率会降下来。

sentence.Network_en: Instead of moving at his usual stately pace, he was almost running.
sentence.Network_cn: 他没像平时那样优雅庄重地走着，而是几乎跑了起来。

sentence.Network_en: With four laps to go, he kept pace with the leaders.
sentence.Network_cn: 还剩4圈的时候，他紧紧咬住领先者。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French pas, from Latin passus 'stretch (of the leg'), from pandere 'to stretch'
Latin, literally in peace', ablative of pax, as in pace tua 'by your leave'

entry.def: The pace of something is the speed at which it happens or is done.

example.ex: Many people were not satisfied with the pace of change.
example.tran: 很多人对变革的步伐不满意。

example.ex: ...people who prefer to live at a slower pace...
example.tran: 乐于放慢生活节奏的人

entry.def: Your pace is the speed at which you walk.

example.ex: He moved at a brisk pace down the rue St Antoine...
example.tran: 他沿着圣安托万街轻快地走去。

example.ex: Their pace quickened as they approached their cars.
example.tran: 走近自己的车时，他们加快了脚步。

entry.def: A pace is the distance that you move when you take one step.

example.ex: He'd only gone a few paces before he stopped again...
example.tran: 他只走了几步远就又停了下来。

entry.tran: （由于焦虑或不耐烦而）在…踱步
entry.def: If you pace a small area, you keep walking up and down it, because you are anxious or impatient.

example.ex: As they waited, Kravis paced the room nervously...
example.tran: 他们等的时候，克拉维斯在屋里不安地踱来踱去。

example.ex: He found John pacing around the flat, unable to sleep...
example.tran: 他发现约翰在公寓里来回踱步，无法入睡。

entry.def: If you pace yourself when doing something, you do it at a steady rate.

example.ex: It was a tough race and I had to pace myself.
example.tran: 这是场艰苦的比赛，我不得不控制好节奏。

entry.def: If something keeps pace with something else that is changing, it changes quickly in response to it.

example.ex: Farmers are angry because the rise fails to keep pace with inflation.
example.tran: 农民们很气愤，因为提价赶不上通货膨胀。

example.ex: ...a world changing far too fast for her to keep pace.
example.tran: 世界变化得太快，她跟不上

entry.tran: 与…齐头并进（或并驾齐驱）
entry.def: If you keep pace with someone who is walking or running, you succeed in going as fast as them, so that you remain close to them.

example.ex: With four laps to go, he kept pace with the leaders...
example.tran: 还剩4圈的时候，他紧紧咬住领先者。

example.ex: Daisy strode alongside her, breathing heavily but keeping pace.
example.tran: 黛西在她身边大步走着，大口喘着气，但是没有落后。

entry.def: If you do something at your own pace , you do it at a speed that is comfortable for you.

example.ex: The computer will give students the opportunity to learn at their own pace...
example.tran: 计算机让学生们有机会按照自己的节奏学习。

example.ex: She was going too fast so I decided to keep riding at my own pace.
example.tran: 她骑得太快了，所以我决定按自己的速度骑。

entry.tran: 考查…的能力/ 展现…的才能
entry.def: If you put someone through their paces or make them go through their paces, you get them to show you how well they can do something.

example.ex: The British coach is putting the boxers through their paces...
example.tran: 英国教练正在检验拳手们的能力。

example.ex: A group of the world's best waterskiers will be going through their paces.
example.tran: 一队世界上最优秀的滑水运动员将一展身手。

means.word_mean: 1. the rate of moving (especially walking or running)
2. the distance covered by a step;

sentences.sentence: "he stepped off ten paces from the old tree and began to dig"

means.word_mean: 3. the relative speed of progress or change;
4. a step in walking or running
5. the rate of some repeating event
6. a unit of length equal to 3 feet; defined as 91.44 centimeters; originally taken to be the average length of a stride
1. walk with slow or fast paces;

sentences.sentence: "He paced up and down the hall"

means.word_mean: 4. regulate or set the pace of;

Sentence.sentence: There are, however, drawbacks to moving through school at such a brisk pace.

The university has poured resources into peer counseling to help students from inner-city schools adjust to the rigor (严格要求) and faster pace of a university classroom –and also to help minority students overcome the stereotype that they are less qualified.

sentences.en: He turned on the light and began to pace backwards and forwards.
sentences.cn: 他打开电灯并开始走来走去。

sentences.en: The lion paced the floor of its cage.
sentences.cn: 那头狮子在笼子里走来走去。

sentences.en: I think the hall is 80 metres long;  I'll pace it.
sentences.cn: 我估计这大厅有80米长; 我来步测一下。

sentences.en: She knew how fast she was running, because her trainer was pacing her on a bicycle.
sentences.cn: 她知道她当时跑得多快, 因为她的教练骑着自行车在为她定步速。

sentences.en: I cannot walk at that pace.
sentences.cn: 我不能以那种速度行走。

sentences.en: The work progressed at a slow pace.
She finished only a few paces behind the winner.
sentences.cn: 到达终点时, 她仅比获胜者落后几步。

sentences.en: The natural paces of the horse include the walk, the trot and the gallop.
sentences.cn: 马的自然溜蹄包括走步、小跑和飞奔。

jushi.english: The old man was pacing leisurely.
She knew how fast she was running, because her trainer was pacing her on a bicycle.
jushi.chinese: 她知道她当时跑得多快,因为她的教练骑着脚踏车在为她定步速。

jushi.english: The lion paced the floor of its cage.
jushi.chinese: 那头狮子在笼子里走来走去。
